memberdef.name: FT_AMALGAMED_SOURCE
memberdef.initializer: /* Macros to make internal libfort functions static */

memberdef.name: FT_CHECK
memberdef.initializer: do { \ tmp = statement; \ if (tmp < 0) {\ PRINT_DEBUG_INFO \ goto clear; \ } \ } while(0)

memberdef.name: CHCK_RSLT_ADD_TO_WRITTEN
memberdef.initializer: do { \ tmp = statement; \ if (tmp < 0) {\ PRINT_DEBUG_INFO \ goto clear; \ } \ written += (size_t)tmp; \ } while(0)

memberdef.name: CHCK_RSLT_ADD_TO_INVISIBLE_WRITTEN
memberdef.initializer: do { \ tmp = statement; \ if (tmp < 0) {\ PRINT_DEBUG_INFO \ goto clear; \ } \ invisible_written += (size_t)tmp; \ } while(0)

memberdef.name: g_default_cell_properties
memberdef.initializer:
= { FT_ANY_ROW, FT_ANY_COLUMN,
FT_CPROP_MIN_WIDTH | FT_CPROP_TEXT_ALIGN | FT_CPROP_TOP_PADDING | FT_CPROP_BOTTOM_PADDING | FT_CPROP_LEFT_PADDING | FT_CPROP_RIGHT_PADDING | FT_CPROP_EMPTY_STR_HEIGHT | FT_CPROP_CONT_FG_COLOR | FT_CPROP_CELL_BG_COLOR | FT_CPROP_CONT_BG_COLOR | FT_CPROP_CELL_TEXT_STYLE | FT_CPROP_CONT_TEXT_STYLE,
0, FT_ALIGNED_LEFT, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1,
FT_ROW_COMMON, FT_COLOR_DEFAULT, FT_COLOR_DEFAULT, FT_COLOR_DEFAULT, FT_TSTYLE_DEFAULT, FT_TSTYLE_DEFAULT, }

detaileddescription.para: Create formatted table.

simplesect.para: The pointer to the new allocated ft_table_t, on success. NULL on error.

detaileddescription.para: Destroy formatted table.
Destroy formatted table and free all resources allocated during table creation and work with it.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to formatted table previousley created with ft_create_table. If table is a null pointer, the function does nothing.

detaileddescription.para: Copy formatted table.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to formatted table previousley created with ft_create_table. If table is a null pointer, the function returns null.

simplesect.para: The pointer to the new allocated ft_table_t, on success. NULL on error.

detaileddescription.para: Move current position to the first cell of the next line(row).

simplesect.para: This function can fail only in case FT_STRATEGY_INSERT adding strategy was set for the table.

detaileddescription.para: Get row number of the current cell.

simplesect.para: Row number of the current cell.

detaileddescription.para: Get column number of the current cell.

simplesect.para: Column number of the current cell.

detaileddescription.para: Set current cell position.
Current cell - cell that will be edited with all modifiing functions (ft_printf, ft_write ...).

parameterdescription.para: New row number for the current cell.
New row number for the current cell.

detaileddescription.para: Check if table is empty.

simplesect.para: 1 - table is empty 0 - some data has been inserted

detaileddescription.para: Get number of rows in the table.

simplesect.para: Number of rows in the table.

memberdef.argsstring: (ft_table_t *table, size_t top_left_row, size_t top_left_col, size_t bottom_right_row, size_t bottom_right_col)
memberdef.name: ft_erase_range

detaileddescription.para: Erase range of cells.
Range of cells is determined by 2 points (top-left and bottom-right) (both ends are included).

parameterdescription.para: Row number of the top left cell in the range.
Column number of the top left cell in the range.
Row number of the bottom right cell in the range.
Column number of the bottom right cell in the range.

memberdef.name: ft_row_printf_impl_

detaileddescription.para: Set field separator for ft_printf, ft_printf_ln (default separator is '|').
Write specified number of strings to the table.
Write specified number of strings to the same number of consecutive cells in the current row.

simplesect.para: In most cases it is more preferable to use MACRO ft_write instead of ft_nwrite, which is more safe (ft_write automatically counts the number of string arguments and at compile check that all passed arguments are strings).

detaileddescription.para: Write specified number of strings to the table and go to the next line.
Write specified number of strings to the same number of consecutive cells in the current row and move current position to the first cell of the next line(row).

simplesect.para: In most cases it is more preferable to use MACRO ft_write instead of ft_nwrite, which is more safe (ft_write automatically counts the number of string arguments and at compile check that all passed arguments are strings).

detaileddescription.para: Write strings from the array to the table.
Write specified number of strings from the array to the same number of consecutive cells in the current row.
Write strings from the array to the table and go to the next line.
Write specified number of strings from the array to the same number of consecutive cells in the current row and move current position to the first cell of the next line(row).

memberdef.argsstring: (ft_table_t *table, size_t rows, size_t cols, const char *table_cells[])
memberdef.name: ft_table_write

detaileddescription.para: Write strings from the 2D array to the table.
Write specified number of strings from the 2D array to the formatted table.

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in the 2D array.
Number of columns in the 2D array.

memberdef.argsstring: (ft_table_t *table, size_t rows, size_t cols, const char *table_cells[])
memberdef.name: ft_table_write_ln

detaileddescription.para: Write strings from the 2D array to the table and go to the next line.
Write specified number of strings from the 2D array to the formatted table and move current position to the first cell of the next line(row).

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in the 2D array.
Number of columns in the 2D array.

detaileddescription.para: Convert table to string representation.
ft_table_t has ownership of the returned pointer. So there is no need to free it. To take ownership user should explicitly copy the returned string with strdup or similar functions.

listitem.para: The pointer to the string representation of formatted table, on success.

detaileddescription.para: Add separator after the current row.
Set default border style for all new formatted tables.

listitem.para: 0: Success; default border style was changed.

detaileddescription.para: Set border style for the table.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the ft_table_t structure.

listitem.para: 0: Success; table border style was changed.

detaileddescription.para: Set functions for memory allocation and deallocation to be used instead of standard ones.

Pointer to a function for memory deallocation that should be used instead of free.

simplesect.para: To return memory allocation/deallocation functions to their standard values set f_malloc and f_free to NULL.

memberdef.name: ft_set_cell_span

detaileddescription.para: Set column span for the specified cell of the table.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the ft_table_t structure.

detaileddescription.para: Set custom function to compute visible width of UTF-8 string.

libfort internally has a very simple logic to compute visible width of UTF-8 strings. It considers that each codepoint will occupy one position on the terminal in case of monowidth font (some east asians wide and fullwidth characters (see http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr11/tr11-33.html) will occupy 2 positions). This logic is very simple and covers wide range of cases. But obviously there a lot of cases when it is not sufficient. In such cases user should use some external libraries and provide an appropriate function to libfort.

parameterdescription.para: User provided function to evaluate width of UTF-8 string ( beg - start of UTF-8 string, end - end of UTF-8 string (not included), width - pointer to the result). If function succeed it should return 0, otherwise some non- zero value. If function returns nonzero value libfort fallbacks to default internal algorithm.
